availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. England (Carter County, KY, physician )

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Son of Hannah England. Married to Sarah R. England. Father of Laura England and Anna England. Physician in Carter County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Carter County in 1850. Physician in Carter County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District No. 2, p. 246B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District No. 2, p. 915.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 260.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 248A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Menard County, Township 18 Range 6, p. 42A.
Find A Grave, "Dr William Lee England (1822-1882)," Memorial 24059222, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24059222 (accessed January 31, 2020).
